intro: Isolepis boeckeleri, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. Its inflorescence consists of dense, spike-like clusters of small flowers, which are typically wind-pollinated. Isolepis boeckeleri plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
